title: Instructional Design for Early Childhood Programming Education: Project-Based Learning Approach

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic mathematics and pedagogy, awareness of programming concepts
context.additional_context: A structured course for pre-service teachers to systematically acquire and practice programming education methodologies for young children.

learning_goals: One can explain educational strategies for utilizing programming blocks (ScratchJr) tailored to the cognitive characteristics of young learners.
One can design a programming education curriculum for young children by applying project-based learning (PBL).
One can apply methods to evaluate educational effectiveness by analyzing patterns of programming blocks selected by young learners.

resources: Sample Programming Manipulatives for Early Childhood
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
